column4: Vista first, Ubuntu yesterday... The error shows up after I installed EasyBCD yesterday in order to actually see the dual boot, and once I select the Ubuntu boot it gives me the error
I'm kinda hopeless now... re-installed Ubuntu 3 times already and nothing works :(
just install grub to your MBR and it'll be simpler for you
that is installed by default at the end of the ubuntu install - you just need to tell it to install to the MBR (/dev/hda or /dev/sda)
you chose to install to the partition you installed ubuntu to I expect... that's wrong
so where should I install it?
accept the default

that would work but it'll be hard for you... if you don't know what you're doing I reccomend a fresh install so it can detect things and give you sane defaults... when you get to the bootloader step you could ask q's here ;)
I already tried that (in my case it was /dev/sdb)
I have an old IDE, and the one BIOS starts with is my SATA. It is still /dev/sdb
thats your problem... it'ws confusing grub
can you make it have your boot drive as sda?
I can try

my system is actually that way also... it's possible to make it work but you have to manually fix the grub config... the scripts don't have any way to know that sdb is really the first drive the bios sees
so I need to menually change device.map?
if it doesn't get the order of your devices correctly, yes
alright, i'll give it a go
you should install it to whatever drive your BIOS boots to
grub would probably happily clobber it.. but it may have some strange things on your windows partition so thats not a bad idea ;)
thank you SO much
